content:
Is it in scope for this working group to talk about some larger tasks about docs?

On my mind are things like

  • restructure the config and install guide to be actually usable again,
  • adapt things like https://docs.divio.com/documentation-system,
  • migrate from RST to MD or AsciiDoc, even enable moving away from Sphinx,
  • include better REST API docs etc

Great. I'm happy to throw in effort where possible (my plate's already quite full) and try to convince more people to welcome/encourage this. Some serious community efforts in these areas would be great. I've been with this project for so long, I start to ignore the flaws of our docs as I know my way around.
Lots of flaws but we can improve them bit by bit. :grinning:
We do have the ability to migrate from .rst to .md already, by the way. The Contributor Guide is written in Markdown, for example.

Speaking of switching away from Sphinx, @kuhlaid created this issue:

Feature Request/Idea: switching from Sphinx docs to using Docusaurus #8905

He even made a prototype: https://dataverse-docusaurus.vercel.app/docs/user-guide/account

This is a whole topic, of course, switching away from Sphinx, but I'd feel remiss if I didn't mention it. :grinning:
